Adult light morph (borealis).description: Red-tailed Hawks lack the extensive brown head and upper breast of Swainson's Hawks. Red-tailed has a band of streaks across the belly that Swainson's lack.

Adult dark morph (calurus/alascensis).description: Dark morph Red-tailed Hawks are best told from Swainson's by shape: Red-tailed has broad, rounded wings, unlike Swainson's long, somewhat pointed wings that they hold slightly raised in a dihedral.

Adult light morph.description: Ferruginous Hawks are very pale underneath, lacking Swainson's Hawk's brown hood and dark trailing edge of the wing.

Dark morph.description: Dark morph Ferruginous Hawks have pale patches in the underside of the outer primaries, while dark morph Swainson's Hawks are uniformly dark on the underwing.

Adult light morph.description: When perched, White-tailed Hawks have gray heads and reddish brown patches on the shoulders, whereas Swainson's are uniform brown above. They lack the brown upper breast of Swainson's Hawk.

Immature.description: Immature White-tailed Hawks usually have a noticeable white chest patch, which Swainson's Hawks lack.
